prompt:
Write Python code that defines the following pandas DataFrame representing patient admissions:

import pandas as pd
data = {
    "PatientID": ["P001", "P002", "P003", "P004", "P005", "P006", "P007", "P008"],
    "AdmissionDate": pd.to_datetime(["2025-01-10", "2025-01-12", "2025-01-15", "2025-01-18", "2025-01-20", "2025-01-22", "2025-01-23", "2025-01-25"]),
    "DischargeDate": pd.to_datetime(["2025-01-15", "2025-01-16", "2025-01-22", "2025-01-25", "2025-01-24", "2025-01-28", "2025-01-30", "2025-02-02"]),
    "Diagnosis": ["Flu", "Cold", "Flu", "Injury", "Cold", "Flu", "Injury", "Flu"],
    "Age": [34, 56, 23, 45, 67, 30, 50, 28],
    "Gender": ["Male", "Female", "Female", "Male", "Male", "Female", "Male", "Female"]
}
df = pd.DataFrame(data)

After creating the DataFrame, the code should: 1) Calculate a new column "LengthOfStay" in days. 2) For each unique "Diagnosis", calculate the average "LengthOfStay" and the total number of patients. 3) Print this information (Diagnosis, Average LengthOfStay, Patient Count). 4) Identify and print the "Diagnosis" that has the longest average "LengthOfStay". Provide only Python code.
evaluation_criteria: Code should correctly define the DataFrame, calculate LengthOfStay, compute average stay and patient count per diagnosis, print these details, and correctly identify the diagnosis with the longest average stay.
